info.description: The revenue service enables applications to access Workday Financials Revenue data.
info.title: revenue

tags.name: billableTransactions
tags.description: All Billable Transactions not invoiced in Workday.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of billing rate applications for the specified billable transaction.
get.description: Retrieves all billing rate applications for the specified billable project transaction. Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Project Billing, Project Tracking

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single billable transaction instance.
get.description: Retrieves a billable project transaction with the specified ID. Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Project Billing, Project Tracking

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A37 | Request doesn't contain valid Document_Status_ID, use Awaiting Review, Ready to Bill, On Hold, or Do Not Bill.
A49 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Billed status.
A55 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Do Not Bill status.
A71 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Approval In Process status.
A1383 | You can't update transactions with a Closed status

patch.summary: Partially updates an existing billable transaction instance.
patch.description: Partially updates an existing billable project transaction instance with the specified ID and the specified data in the request body. This endpoint is equivalent to the Manage Project Billing Transactions task in Workday. Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing - Core Scope: Project Billing, Project Tracking

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A37 | Request doesn't contain valid Document_Status_ID, use Awaiting Review, Ready to Bill, On Hold, or Do Not Bill.
A49 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Billed status.
A55 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Do Not Bill status.
A71 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Approval In Process status.
A1383 | You can't update transactions with a Closed status

get.summary: Retrieves a single billing rate application instance.
get.description: Retrieves a billing rate application with the specified subresource ID for the specified billable project transaction. Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Project Billing, Project Tracking

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of billable transactions.
get.description: Retrieves all billable project transactions. You must filter the billable transactions by one of the following: customer {id}, project {id}, or transactionSource {id}. Secured by: Manage: Project Details, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Project Billing, Project Tracking

parameters.name: billingStatus
parameters.description:
Filters the billable transactions by status. Specify the Workday ID of the status. You can specify multiple status query parameters.

Valid values:

* 3d46fe27ed464f9aaaddcd510731c5f0 - Approval In Process

* b8f58d21282249c9b8ad2391adb3ef9d - Awaiting Review

* 62a1b884a62d448899b34628026efcae - Billed

* 275424eaf82743ed8d17d755cd8d91a7 - Billing In Progress

* 743da2a9c0fc45d0843702e7385a79ff - Do Not Bill

* 2cc0607f96b4433f860134953788caab - On Hold

* 46328a05acf110000b5601a2b76a008b - Partially Billed

* 8c4f33a55c774494a07ec40dd3b6b44f - Ready To Bill

* aeb6a01a4a8a4a2780582fc5c665ef57 - Unbillable

parameters.name: customer
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the customer associated with the project for the billable transaction. To get a valid ID, you can call GET /customers in the Customer Accounts REST service.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Filters the billable transactions with transaction date on or after the specified date. Use the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: phase
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the project phase associated with the billable transaction for the time entry. To get a valid ID, call GET /planPhases in the Projects REST service.

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the project associated with the billable transactions. To get a valid ID, you can call GET /projects in the Projects REST service.

parameters.name: spendCategory
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the spend category for the billable transaction associated with the expense report line.

parameters.name: task
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the project task associated with the billable transaction for the time entry.  To get a valid ID, call GET /planTasks in the Projects REST service.

parameters.name: timeCode
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the time code for the billable transaction associated with the time entry.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: Filters the billable transactions with transaction date on or before the specified date. Use the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: transactionSource
parameters.description:
Filters the billable transactions by transaction source. Specify the Workday ID of the transaction source.

Valid values:

* 3c4a245325f44745b13a4553c4810524 - Expense

* 381908377f9c100005d7078e86a2003e - Misc Expense

* 6b404c3fa9f34512b0490da5f4237573 - Supplier Invoice

* 7a55a775b63b4b9b8a5b3722fc1e4556 - Time

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker associated with the billable transaction. To get a valid ID, call GET /workers in the Staffing service.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A37 | Request doesn't contain valid Document_Status_ID, use Awaiting Review, Ready to Bill, On Hold, or Do Not Bill.
A49 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Billed status.
A55 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Do Not Bill status.
A71 | You can't modify amounts on transactions with a Approval In Process status.
A1383 | You can't update transactions with a Closed status

id.description: Workday Id or Reference Id of the instance.

descriptor.description: The display name of the instance

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet
